content:
Diagnosis:	Metastatic clear cell renal cell carcinoma

Management:	Left radical nephrectomy March 2023
		Pazopanib commenced May 2023, discontinued August 2023
		Cabozantinib commenced September 2023

Histology:	Clear cell renal cell carcinoma, WHO/ISUP grade 3, with sarcomatoid features
		pT4N1 with renal vein invasion
		VEGF expression high on immunohistochemistry

Current Situation:	Progressive disease on cabozantinib

I saw [redacted name] today accompanied by his wife. Unfortunately, his most recent CT scan from last week shows disease progression with growth of both liver metastases and new pulmonary nodules. The largest liver lesion has increased from 3.2cm to 4.8cm, and there are three new pulmonary nodules measuring up to 8mm. His bone metastases in the thoracic spine remain stable following the palliative radiotherapy he received in October 2023.

He has been struggling with increasing fatigue and right upper quadrant discomfort. His appetite has significantly decreased over the past month, and he has lost 4kg in weight. His mobility has declined, and he now requires a walking frame for all movements. His performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 3.

The cabozantinib was initially well-tolerated, but he has developed grade 2 palmar-plantar syndrome and persistent diarrhea despite dose reduction to 40mg daily in November 2023. His blood pressure remains well-controlled on amlodipine.

Given the clear evidence of disease progression and declining performance status, we have had a detailed discussion about treatment options. We have agreed to discontinue cabozantinib and transition to best supportive care. I have made a referral to the palliative care team and arranged for urgent review next week. We will also arrange a hospice assessment given his rapid decline.

I have prescribed additional analgesia and anti-emetics today. The district nurses will commence regular home visits for symptom monitoring. We will review him again in two weeks' time, or sooner if needed through our acute oncology service.
